metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10228 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-10228` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.34-0ubuntu3
libc-bin - 2.34-0ubuntu3
libc6 - 2.34-0ubuntu3
libc6-amd64 - 2.34-0ubuntu3
libc6-i386 - 2.34-0ubuntu3
libc6-prof - 2.34-0ubuntu3
libc6-s390 - 2.34-0ubuntu3
libc6-x32 - 2.34-0ubuntu3
locales - 2.34-0ubuntu3
locales-all - 2.34-0ubuntu3
nscd - 2.34-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.34-0ubuntu3').
